intro: Thyrsia viridula, commonly known as the green thyrsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Thyrsia viridula is typically found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
